basic.description: This course introduces students to the current theories used for business strategy in a manufacturing environment including product streams, theory of constraints, lean/agile manufacturing, supply chain management, and reliability/maintenance programs. The fundamentals, tools, advantages and disadvantages for each strategy are examined.  First hand interaction with various analytical tools will be a major feature of the course. Case studies featuring automotive related industries and their suppliers will be used to highlight the potential uses and value of the product stream approach. Participants will have the opportunity to use the analytical tools to conduct additional analyses and construct their own business strategy models.(Lead Instructor: Gian Frontini, Queen's)
